modelrailway.vehicles

Class Train

  • java.lang.Object
    • modelrailway.BaseObject
      • modelrailway.vehicles.Train

  • public class Train
extends BaseObject
    This class describes a train. A train is a composition of 1 locomotive at least and 0 or more wagons.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Simon Styger

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Train(java.util.List<Locomotive> locomotives, java.util.List<Wagon> wagons)
      Constructor to create a normal train with 1 or more locomotives and 1 or more wagons.
      Train(Locomotive locomotive)
      Constructor for the most primitive example of a train with just 1 locomotive an 0 wagons.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      This method adds a locomotive to this train.

      This method adds a wagon to this train.

      Returns all locomotives in this train.
      int getPower()
      This method calculates the effective power of all locomotives of this train.

      Returns all wagons in this train.

      void setOnRailway(RailRoad railRoad)

      • Train

        public Train(java.util.List<Locomotive> locomotives,
     java.util.List<Wagon> wagons)
      throws java.lang.Exception
        Constructor to create a normal train with 1 or more locomotives and 1 or more wagons.
        Parameters:
        locomotivesm, - the list of locomotives which should be added to this train.
        wagons, - the list of wagons which should be added to this train.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if locomotives doesn't contain at least one item.
